issues.message: Insufficient test coverage for edge cases - missing tests for boundary values like 12:00 AM, 12:00 PM, and malformed time formats
issues.description: Insufficient test coverage for edge cases - missing tests for boundary values like 12:00 AM, 12:00 PM, and malformed time formats This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add more comprehensive test cases including 12:00 AM (midnight), 12:00 PM (noon), single-digit hours, malformed formats, and boundary times like 12:59 AM/PM

fix.newCode:
func testValidTimes() {
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30 AM"), 9 * 60 + 30)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "11:59 PM"), 23 * 60 + 59)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:00 AM"), 0)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:00 PM"), 12 * 60)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "1:00 AM"), 1 * 60)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:59 PM"), 12 * 60 + 59)
    }

    func testInvalidTimes() {
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: ""))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "invalid"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "25:00 AM"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:60 PM"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30 XM"))
    }
fix.description: Add more comprehensive test cases including 12:00 AM (midnight), 12:00 PM (noon), single-digit hours, malformed formats, and boundary times like 12:59 AM/PM
fix.content:
func testValidTimes() {
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30 AM"), 9 * 60 + 30)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "11:59 PM"), 23 * 60 + 59)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:00 AM"), 0)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:00 PM"), 12 * 60)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "1:00 AM"), 1 * 60)
        XCTAssertEqual(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:59 PM"), 12 * 60 + 59)
    }

    func testInvalidTimes() {
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: ""))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "invalid"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "25:00 AM"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "12:60 PM"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30"))
        XCTAssertNil(parseTimeHMMA(timeString: "9:30 XM"))
    }

for session in sessions {
            let endTime = session.endTime?.description ?? ""
            let sanitizedTaskName = "\"\(session.taskName.replacingOccurrences(of: "\"", with: "\"\""))\""
            let row = [
                sanitizedTaskName,
                "\"\(session.startTime.description)\"",
                "\"\(endTime)\"",
                String(Int(session.duration)),
                session.isCompleted.description,
                String(session.emergencyBreaks.count),
                String(session.interruptions.count)
            ].joined(separator: ",")

            csvString += row + "\n"
        }
fix.description: Sanitize CSV data by escaping special characters and wrapping fields in quotes
fix.content:
for session in sessions {
            let endTime = session.endTime?.description ?? ""
            let sanitizedTaskName = "\"\(session.taskName.replacingOccurrences(of: "\"", with: "\"\""))\""
            let row = [
                sanitizedTaskName,
                "\"\(session.startTime.description)\"",
                "\"\(endTime)\"",
                String(Int(session.duration)),
                session.isCompleted.description,
                String(session.emergencyBreaks.count),
                String(session.interruptions.count)
            ].joined(separator: ",")

            csvString += row + "\n"
        }
